title: How to Make Rose Vinegar

steps.headline: Wash the rose petals softly under gentle running water.
Leave to dry.
steps.description: Place on wax paper, a tea towel or on a wire cookie rack to dry.

steps.headline: Place the petals at the base of the container and fill with vinegar.
Seal the lid or screw on, as appropriate.
Place the jar or bottle in a sunny position.
steps.description: Leave to infuse in the sun for about one month.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: It can be used in salad dressings, neat on the salad and in many other uses where you require vinegar.

text: Wash the rose petals softly under gentle running water.  Leave to dry. Place on wax paper, a tea towel or on a wire cookie rack to dry. Place the petals at the base of the container and fill with vinegar.  Seal the lid or screw on, as appropriate.  Place the jar or bottle in a sunny position. Leave to infuse in the sun for about one month. Serve. It can be used in salad dressings, neat on the salad and in many other uses where you require vinegar.
